meanings.definition: The quality or state of being negotiable.
meanings.sent1: The negotiability of the contract allowed for changes to be made easily.
meanings.sent2: The negotiability of the price made it possible for both parties to reach a fair agreement.
meanings.sent3: The negotiability of the terms turned a serious discussion into a playful exchange.
meanings.sent4: Her negotiability was like a flexible rope, adapting to different situations effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The negotiability of the deadline made it less stressful for everyone involved.

meanings.definition: The ability to be negotiated or bargained over.
meanings.sent1: His skillful negotiability in business deals always led to successful outcomes.
meanings.sent2: The negotiability of the terms allowed for compromises to be reached smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The negotiability of the price turned the negotiation into a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: Her negotiability shone brightly in the tough world of real estate negotiations.
meanings.sent5: The negotiability of the contract made the whole process much more manageable.
